environmental_bioconcentrations.References: (1) US EPA; Estimation Program Interface (EPI) Suite. Ver. 4.1. Jan, 2010. Available from, as of Dec 28, 2012: https://www.epa.gov/oppt/exposure/pubs/episuitedl.htm (2) Meylan WM, Howard PH; J Pharm Sci 84: 83-92 (1995) (3) Franke C et al; Chemosphere 29: 1501-14 (1994)
environmental_bioconcentrations.Value: An estimated BCF of 82 was calculated in fish for 1,1,1,2-tetrachloro-2,2,-difluoroethane(SRC), using an estimated log Kow of 3.41(1) and a regression-derived equation(2). According to a classification scheme(3), this BCF suggests the potential for bioconcentration in aquatic organisms is moderate(SRC), provided the compound is not metabolized by the organism(SRC).

environmental_biodegradations.References: (1) Sylvestre M et al; Crit Rev Environ Sci Technol 27: 87-111 (1997)
environmental_biodegradations.Value: ANAEROBIC: Structurally similar compounds such as Freon 12 and Freon 114 have been shown to biodegrade under anaerobic conditions(1), suggesting that 1,1,1,2-tetrachloro-2,2-difluoroethane may also biodegrade under anaerobic conditions(SRC).

non_human_toxicity_excerpts.References: American Conference of Governmental Industrial Hygienists, Inc. Documentation of the Threshold Limit Values and Biological Exposure Indices. 6th ed. Volumes I, II, III. Cincinnati, OH: ACGIH, 1991., p. 1502
non_human_toxicity_excerpts.Value: /LABORATORY ANIMALS: Acute Exposure/ ... 15,000 ppm for 4 hours lethal to rats. Animals (rats, mice, guinea pigs, and a rabbit) survived 31 six-hr exposures at 1000 ppm, /although/ some leukopenia and liver changes were noted.

/LABORATORY ANIMALS: Acute Exposure/ Acute inhalation toxicity of 9 substances, including 1,1,1,2-Tetrachloro-2,2-Difluoroethane, was examined by exposing rats to vapors of these compounds. Tetrachloro-2,2-Difluoroethane had a low acute lethal toxicity.

non_human_toxicity_excerpts.References: Rom, W.N. (ed.). Environmental and Occupational Medicine. 2nd ed. Boston, MA: Little, Brown and Company, 1992., p. 1300
non_human_toxicity_excerpts.Value: /LABORATORY ANIMALS: Acute Exposure/ ... Chlorofluorocarbons could sensitize the canine myocardium to adrenaline, resulting in serious cardiac arrhythmias. /CFCs/

non_human_toxicity_excerpts.References: WHO; Environmental Health Criteria 113: Fully Halogenated Chlorofluorocarbons p.74 (1990)
non_human_toxicity_excerpts.Value: /LABORATORY ANIMALS: Acute Exposure/ When applied to the skin of rabbits, ... CFC-112a at 11 g/kg caused severe skin irritation ... .

non_human_toxicity_excerpts.References: American Conference of Governmental Industrial Hygienists. Documentation of the TLV's and  BEI's 7th Edition. 1,1,1,2-Tetrachloro-2,2-Difluoroethane p. 1 CD-ROM Cincinnati, OH 45240-4148 2012.
non_human_toxicity_excerpts.Value: /LABORATORY ANIMALS: Acute Exposure/ All rats exposed by inhalation to either 10,000 or 12,500 ppm CFC-112a survived a single 4-hour exposure. All rats exposed for four hours at 15,000 ppm died. In each group, some rats showed focal liver necrosis when examined 14 days post treatment.

non_human_toxicity_excerpts.References: American Conference of Governmental Industrial Hygienists. Documentation of the TLV's and  BEI's 7th Edition. 1,1,1,2-Tetrachloro-2,2-Difluoroethane p. 1 CD-ROM Cincinnati, OH 45240-4148 2012.
non_human_toxicity_excerpts.Value: /LABORATORY ANIMALS: Acute Exposure/ Rats exposed by inhalation at either 5,000 or 10,000 ppm CFC-112a for seven hours showed low level /CNS depressant/ effects following transient central stimulation. Rats did not survive exposure to 20,000 ppm, and rats from all groups showed minimal hepatocyte degeneration and cloudy swelling in the kidneys.

non_human_toxicity_excerpts.References: American Conference of Governmental Industrial Hygienists. Documentation of the TLV's and  BEI's 7th Edition. 1,1,1,2-Tetrachloro-2,2-Difluoroethane  p. 1. CD-ROM Cincinnati, OH 45240-4148 2012.
non_human_toxicity_excerpts.Value: /LABORATORY ANIMALS: Acute Exposure/ Rats exposed for 1.5 to 2 hours at 10,000 ppm showed incoordination. The corneal reflex was absent at 15,000 ppm, and 20,000 to 30,000 ppm was fatal in 1.5 to 2 hours.

non_human_toxicity_excerpts.References: American Conference of Governmental Industrial Hygienists. Documentation of the TLV's and  BEI's 7th Edition. 1,1,1,2-Tetrachloro-2,2-Difluoroethane p. 1. CD-ROM Cincinnati, OH 45240-4148 2012.
non_human_toxicity_excerpts.Value: /LABORATORY ANIMALS: Acute Exposure/ A group of rats was exposed at 10,000 ppm for 21 hours and survived without any microscopic lung damage.

non_human_toxicity_excerpts.References: American Conference of Governmental Industrial Hygienists. Documentation of the TLV's and  BEI's 7th Edition. 1,1,1,2-Tetrachloro-2,2-Difluoroethane p. 1 CD-ROM Cincinnati, OH 45240-4148 2012.
non_human_toxicity_excerpts.Value: /LABORATORY ANIMALS: Acute Exposure/  Rats given 25,000 mg/kg CFC-112a dose showed a temporary weight loss for two days, followed by normal weight gain. No histologic tissue changes were seen when the rats were examined 14 days post-dosing.

non_human_toxicity_excerpts.References: American Conference of Governmental Industrial Hygienists. Documentation of the TLV's and  BEI's 7th Edition. 1,1,1,2-Tetrachloro-2,2-Difluoroethane p. 1 CD-ROM Cincinnati, OH 45240-4148 2012.
non_human_toxicity_excerpts.Value: /LABORATORY ANIMALS: Acute Exposure/ No mortality was seen in two rabbits given dermal doses of 11,000 mg CFC-112a/kg, and no tissue changes were detected histologically when the rabbits were examined 14 days post-treatment.

non_human_toxicity_excerpts.References: American Conference of Governmental Industrial Hygienists. Documentation of the TLV's and  BEI's 7th Edition. 1,1,1,2-Tetrachloro-2,2-Difluoroethane p. 2 CD-ROM Cincinnati, OH 45240-4148 2012.
non_human_toxicity_excerpts.Value: /LABORATORY ANIMALS: Acute Exposure/ Severe skin irritation was seen when CFC-112a was applied to the skin of rabbits in ethanol, but no irritation was seen when applied in dimethyl phthalate.

non_human_toxicity_excerpts.References: WHO; Environmental Health Criteria 113: Fully Halogenated Chlorofluorocarbons (1990)
non_human_toxicity_excerpts.Value: /LABORATORY ANIMALS: Acute Exposure/ CFC-112a (11 g/kg) caused histological changes in skin musculature and weight loss.

non_human_toxicity_excerpts.References: American Conference of Governmental Industrial Hygienists. Documentation of the TLV's and  BEI's 7th Edition.1,1,1,2-Tetrachloro-2,2-Difluoroethane  p. 2 CD-ROM Cincinnati, OH 45240-4148 2012.
non_human_toxicity_excerpts.Value: /LABORATORY ANIMALS: Subchronic or Prechronic Exposure/ No effects were observed in rats exposed at 1,000 ppm via inhalation for 18 hours/day over 17 days. The lungs, liver and spleen were examined for histologic changes. No findings were obtained in rats exposed by inhalation at 5,000 ppm for two 18 hour periods.

non_human_toxicity_excerpts.References: American Conference of Governmental Industrial Hygienists. Documentation of the TLV's and  BEI's 7th Edition. 1,1,1,2-Tetrachloro-2,2-Difluoroethane  p. 2 CD-ROM Cincinnati, OH 45240-4148 2012.
non_human_toxicity_excerpts.Value: /LABORATORY ANIMALS: Subchronic or Prechronic Exposure/ No changes were produced in a group of rats given oral gavage doses of 2,000 mg/kg (inhalation equivalent of 1,750 ppm) of CFC-112a/kg for 23 to 33 days. An oral dose of 5,000 mg/kg given for 10 days to rats produced weight loss, diarrhea, tremors, and incoordination without any evidence of histologic damage to any tissues.

soil_absorption_mobility.References: (1) Meylan WM et al; Environ Sci Technol 26: 1560-67 (1992) (2) Swann RL et al; Res Rev 85: 17-28 (1983)
soil_absorption_mobility.Value: Using a structure estimation method based on molecular connectivity indices(1), the Koc for 1,1,1,2-tetrachloro-2,2,-difluoroethane can be estimated to be 200(SRC). According to a classification scheme(2), this estimated Koc value suggests that 1,1,1,2-tetrachloro-2,2,-difluoroethane is expected to have moderate mobility in soil.
